revised_title: The Discovery and Identity of Myokinase as the Marsh Factor
tldr: The authors discovered that myokinase, an enzyme found in muscle tissue, has the same properties as the Marsh factor. The Marsh factor is known to inhibit ATP-induced muscle contraction and bring about muscle relaxation. Myokinase and the Marsh factor both have similar effects on muscle fibers, such as reducing ATP-ase activity and causing muscle fibers to lengthen. The authors conclude that myokinase and the Marsh factor are identical.
